intro: Gastrochilus × hsuehshanensis, commonly known as the Hsuehshan orchid, is a hybrid orchid species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers with a distinctive coloration, often in shades of white and pink. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and ornamental value, it is considered a rare and valuable species in horticulture.
